parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system can cause extended stopping distances, loss of control, and accidents, which can lead to injuries or fatalities.
symptoms: The ABS light stays on
the brakes grab or pulsate
the vehicle takes longer to stop
the brakes lock up
the vehicle experiences reduced braking ability
especially on rough terrain or in wet weather conditions.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Brake drag and overheating can cause the brakes to lock up, leading to loss of control and accidents.
symptoms: The brakes drag
overheat
and lock up
especially on long downhill grades or when driving in heavy traffic.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of brake rotors and pads can cause reduced braking ability, leading to extended stopping distances and accidents.
symptoms: The brake rotors rust and need to be replaced
the brake pads wear out prematurely.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of brake hoses can cause brake fluid leaks, leading to reduced braking ability and accidents.
symptoms: The brake hose ruptures
causing brake fluid leaks.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the horn can lead to accidents or injuries, as the driver is unable to alert other vehicles or pedestrians of their presence.
symptoms: The horn does not work
is difficult to press
or is inoperable due to hot weather temperatures melting the mechanisms. The horn buttons are small and difficult to locate in emergency situations
and may slip out of place or break easily.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the electrical system can cause a vehicle fire, leading to accidents or injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle caught fire due to alternator failure
with the fire originating from the dashboard compartment.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the ABS system can cause accidents or injuries, as the vehicle's braking system is compromised.
symptoms: The ABS light came on while driving
and the dealership found that the wires running from the front to the back along the frame had shorted out due to rubbing against the frame.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the front lower control arm can cause the suspension to collapse, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries.
symptoms: The vehicle's front end suspension feels unstable
the wheels make noise when turning
the vehicle's frame is damaged
the bolt holding the suspension to the frame is loose or hanging off
the self-locking nut has come off.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear lower control arm can cause the suspension to collapse, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries.
symptoms: The rear lower control arm is cracked
the stabilizer is damaged
the vehicle's rear suspension feels unstable.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the rear coil spring can cause the suspension to collapse, leading to loss of vehicle control, accidents, and potential injuries.
symptoms: The rear coil spring is not properly seated or welded
the vehicle's rear suspension feels unstable.
